* Premium International Luxury Brand

passionate Store Manager on a Full Time basis, reporting

Simone Perele Brighton store.


As a Store Manager you are naturally results driven and

always strive to get the best results from your team on a

daily basis. You have a sound background in people

management and have a proven track record of

developing your team's skills set. A strong retail Store

Manager background is a must, in conjunction with an

ability to affect positive change and drive results with

your store team.


We are seeking an engaged and dynamic individual who

is not afraid to lead from the front, and who can continue

achieving goals, whilst developing a high-performing

team.

* Ensure excellent customer service is provided by all

* Provide staff training and guidance by developing

achieving sales targets

store

* Monitor the store’s inventory to maximize sales/profits

* Must have experience and commitment to building our

customer loyalty with an enthusiastic approach

* Experience in the lingerie industry preferred but not

essential as training will be provided


This role will suit a self-motivated team player who is

passionate about what they do and the people they work

with, thrives on delivering quality innovative results as

well as enjoys working in a busy and autonomous

environment.

over 93 countries around the world including Bergdorf

Goodman, Harvey Nichols, Galleries Lafayette and David

Jones. This is a very exciting time to join our dynamic

AU/NZ operation.


If you possess the diligent 'can do' attitude required for

this role, then we would like to hear from you. Please

send through your application to karina@simone-perele.

com.au

Company Name safesearch Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 58 views

Job description

  • Make your mark on safety
  • Challenging and rewarding opportunity
  • Melbourne based – Flexible location


Your Opportunity
Our client is an established medium sized organisation within the facilities and management services sector. They service a diverse range of clients and have sites located across Victoria and plans to increase their footprint. They have a reputable brand and a positive culture, and as a result of ongoing business success they are now seeking a HSEQ / HR manager to be in charge of the people and safety team.

The Role
Reporting directly to the managing director, you will be a key safety and HR professional.

To be successful you will bring the following:

  • Exceptional communication and influencing skills, which are used to form strong relationships with operational managers and leaders in the business
  • Experience managing a team and heading up a department
  • Broad HSE knowledge, including leading investigations, risk management and maintaining certification for ISO 9001, ISO14001 and ASNZS 4801, including internal and external audits.
  • Proven experience in streamlining and maintaining integrated management systems
  • Previous exposure working for small - medium sized organisations in a duel safety and Human resourcing role will be highly advantageous.
  • A minimum of a Certificate IV in OH&S is required


The Rewards
Are you looking to join an established organisation and make a real impact on their safety culture? This position will allow you to use your previous experience in safety and Human resources to influence and coach the people and safety team.

Please apply online providing your resume in Word format. Alternatively, enquiries are welcome to Nicole Rogalsky on 03 9663 5513 quoting reference number 94671.

Business Development Manager

Company Name SCF Containers Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 62 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Business Development Manager

SCF is one of the largest container providers in Australia. With a focus on quality design, customer service and product innovation, SCF is a leading supplier to the transport, resources, construction and static storage industries. The company operates across the country with branches in Adelaide, Perth, Darwin, Melbourne, Sydney and Brisbane.


We are currently seeking an experienced, well networked Business Development Manager to join the sales team in Melbourne. Reporting directly to the GM of the SCF General Transport Division, the primary purpose of this role is to actively grow our General Transport Division with a key focus on containerised equipment for the intermodal transport sector.


Coming from a strong sales background you will use your excellent communication and negotiation skills to generate new business and build long term relationships with an existing portfolio of customers. You will be passionate, driven and have a strong ability to demonstrate initiative. You will enjoy working in an autonomous environment and genuinely contribute to the overall growth of the company.


Duties include but not limited to: \xa0

  • Actively pursuing and converting new hire and sale opportunities
  • Developing and managing existing accounts as well as new customer prospects to identify and realise growth and equipment deployment opportunities
  • CRM input and management including quote preparation
  • Exceed annual growth targets set by the General Manager
  • Prepare, review and present new tender applications to secure major contracts
  • Develop a technical understanding of the SCF product range
  • Develop an understanding of customer’s markets & needs, creating value to their business.\xa0


Essential criteria to be successful in these roles:

  • 5+ years’ experience in an outbound sales environment
  • Proven sales professional with an ability to work autonomously and deliver positive results
  • Track record of developing and maintaining sustainable commercial relationships
  • Creative and innovative thinking
  • The ability to plan and think strategically in line with organisational goals
  • Excellent presentation skills / great verbal and written communications
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong ability to negotiate and influence key stakeholders
  • Energy, drive and determination
  • Knowledge of container and road equipment or an operations background (desirable)


Our Values

SCF is an equal opportunity employer with a strong focus on values. Get it Right for the Customer | Solutions not Problems | Honest and Open | Play as a Team | Own the Outcome.

For more information on the company, please visit our website at: www.scf.com.au

839265728:
[

Experienced Workshop Manager

Company Name The Bitu-mill Group Company Location 133 Metrolink Circuit , Campbellfield , VIC 3062, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 120 views

Job description

About Bitu-mill

Bitu-mill is a major player in the Road Construction Industry that prides itself on delivering excellence in the field. Building on years of success and strong client relationships, our family orientated business continues its expansion rapidly.

We are currently seeking an experienced Workshop Manager to join the group, to lead the development of workshop functions, manage our mechanics and workshop assistants, while controlling our continually expanding fleet in all facets of the company.

Successful candidates will join a diverse, highly capable and well-respected organisation that is committed to being the leader in the industry.

At Bitu-mill, we focus on:

  • Superior results every time,

  • Win-win outcomes,

  • Attracting and retaining the best people in the industry

  • Our Core Values, which are Sustainability, Integrity, Transparency, Performance and Respect.

About the Role

Bitu-mill is seeking an experience Workshop Manager to manage the Bitu-mill plant and equipment maintenance in accordance with the company requirements and systems. \xa0

Reporting directly to the General Manager:

You will be responsible for:

  • Ensure Daily Plant Inspection Checklists are collected and defects recorded either from the Ipad or paper;

  • Allocate resources to undertake maintenance and servicing as required;

  • Allocate job sheets to the Workshop mechanics and ensure that they are collected and filed for each job sheet at the completion of the maintenance works;

  • Ensure that managers and operators are made aware of plant and equipment that is approaching service intervals and arrange servicing;

  • Ensure all maintenance records are accurately compiled and kept on file;

  • Works with our suppliers and maintenance contractors to ensure that Bitu-mill optimises is repair and maintenance costs;

  • Maintain all plant in accordance with company systems, manufacturers and regulatory requirements

  • Maintain accurate reporting on plant and equipment logistics

  • Manage all Bitu-mill plant in accordance with system requirements and statutory regulations

  • Ensure robust reporting frameworks are established and maintained to assist decision making

  • Support a culture of ‘Safety above all else’ within the workshop

About You

You will possess & have proven knowledge of the following

  • Trade qualified with strong plant servicing and maintenance experience

  • Knowledge of road construction equipment and hydraulics

  • Excellent written communication & interpersonal skills

  • Strong reporting focus

  • Competent computer skills with experience using Microsoft Office software

  • Attention to detail

  • Ability to coordinate several projects at a time

  • Excellent time management & multi-tasking skills

  • Flexible with duties

  • Team/Workshop Management Experience preferred.

    \xa0

Opportunity

The main benefit of this role is the opportunity to join an excellent company who strongly believe ‘The people of the company are the company’ – Other benefits include:

  • Excellent salary package – Negotiable depending on experience

  • +Super

  • Career Progression Opportunities

This is a rewarding opportunity to work with an industry leading organisation that is well-established and strongly values the wellbeing of their workers and the community. You will be offered great working conditions and for the right candidates, a great remuneration package.

\xa0

Please register your interest and apply online today, or via email

838984288:
[

Executive Assistant to the CEO

Company Name Domestic Violence Resource Centre Victoria (DVRCV) Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 324 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Are you experienced in providing effective, proactive and professional executive support?
  • Full time, ongoing position
  • Generous leave entitlements and salary packaging are available


DVRCV actively encourages applications from women from culturally diverse backgrounds, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander women and women with disabilities. If you are interested in the role but feel you may not meet the full range of selection criteria, we encourage you to contact us to discuss your experience and application for this position.


About DVRCV:

Domestic Violence Resource Centre Victoria (DVRCV)’s vision is to create a world in which gender equality ensures women and their children are thriving, respected and free from violence.

We are a statewide organisation working across prevention and response providing:

  • Training courses, forums, events and workshops
  • Resources for professionals, victims, friends and family
  • Family violence websites and online resources
  • Advocacy and policy advice
  • Information and referrals


Your Role:

The Executive Assistant is responsible for providing a high level of administrative and executive support to the CEO. This position is also responsible for providing proactive, efficient and professional administrative and secretarial support to the Senior Leadership Team.

The role will be responsible for administration, stakeholder liaison, basic communications and email and diary management on behalf of the CEO. The Executive Assistant will maintain a high level of confidentiality and use initiative and self-direction to manage the day-to-day requirements of the CEO.


To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Completion of training course/qualifications (or 5 years’ experience) in executive level administration support
  • Demonstrated expertise in supporting executive staff and ability to develop and maintain administrative systems
  • Capacity to be proactive, assertive and work well under pressure or within tight time frames
  • Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to establish friendly and professional rapport with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders
  • Exceptional organisational skills with a passion for planning, organising and prioritising administrative tasks and systems, including managing competing tasks rapidly and ensuring deadlines are met under pressure
  • Proven ability to work independently, prioritise work and show initiative
  • High level written and verbal communication skills
  • Proven ability to maintain accurate records and up to date filing systems
  • Strong computer skills including the use of databases and all Microsoft Office products
  • Attention to detail and ability to respect confidential and/or sensitive documents/correspondence


A full position description and application details are available on our website http://www.dvrcv.org.au/about/jobs. \xa0



\xa0

851921732:
[

Ethical Sourcing Program Administrator

Company Name Workwear Group Company Location Port Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 67 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Pivotal role- driving and supporting our ethical sourcing strategy


Supporting an established Wesfarmers division, Workwear Group


Newly created opportunity due to business growth


As a division of Wesfarmers Limited, Wesfarmers Industrial & Safety (WIS) is Australia’s leading supplier of Industrial and Safety products. Our customers include many of the country’s largest and leading companies who all rely on us to provide Industrial, Safety and Specialist Industrial Equipment needs. This role will heavily support our Workwear Group division based in our Port Melbourne headquarters.


A fantastic opportunity has become available for a strong administrator to join our Merchandising team. You will be responsible for supporting the delivery of the WIS Ethical Sourcing Program and sustainability objectives through the effective implementation, and ongoing development of the WIS Ethical Sourcing framework and business requirements, including monitoring and reporting on corrective actions and supplier performance.


In addition to the above you will be responsible for:



  • Administering the ongoing implementation and monitoring of the WIS Ethical Sourcing Strategy, Framework and Roadmap

  • Driving the effective implementation of the SEDEX registration process with WIS Sourcing and associated Suppliers (Agents, Factories) as per the WIS Ethical Sourcing framework

  • Liaise with External Stakeholders and industry experts to research trends, country risk, emerging issues, benchmarking to identify improvement opportunities to the WIS Ethical Sourcing framework and program

  • Supporting the development and management of policies, risk profile, procedures, process maps, training tools etc. that form part of the WIS Ethical Sourcing compliance program

  • Delivering internal and external training to educate key stakeholders as required

  • Liaising with External Stakeholders and industry experts to research trends, country risk, emerging issues, benchmarking to identify improvement opportunities to the WIS Ethical Sourcing framework and program


As our successful candidate you have proven experience in a related merchandising, product compliance, supply chain, ethical and social compliance or risk management role within a large enterprise organisation. You have exceptional problem solving and negotiation skills and the ability to learn new tasks quickly and work independently in a fast paced environment. You also have excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to build strong relationships across the business. You will be knowledgeable with the Bangladesh Accord and have an understanding of pricing along with intermediate MS Excel skills are essential in your success. Experience with Sedex, Ethical Clothing Australia would be an added benefit with tertiary qualifications in Business or a related field along with an Internal Auditor certification being highly regarded.


In exchange for the above, we will provide you with a competitive remuneration package including participation in Wesfarmers Employee Share Program and genuine development opportunities! Most importantly we offer you a career not just a job!


Want to find out more about WIS? Visit our website www.wiscareers.com.au.


How do I apply?


Click ‘Apply now’ to upload your CV and covering letter.


WIS promotes and adheres to the principles and practices of diversity
